overview_metadata.overview_subtitle: Classifying Shapes on the Coordinate Plane
overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students relate the Distance Formula to the Pythagorean Theorem and calculate the distance between points. They classify quadrilaterals and triangles on the coordinate plane based on the length and slopes of their sides. Students use the converse to the Pythagorean Theorem to identify a triangle as acute, right, or obtuse. They also apply the Midpoint Formula and specify figures formed by connected midpoints.

I can determine the slopes of line segments of quadrilaterals to classify them by their properties.

I can use coordinate geometry to determine the coordinates of an unknown vertex of a quadrilateral.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students identify which two-dimensional shapes have a given property.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Calculating Distance on the Coordinate Plane
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students classify quadrilaterals, using side lengths and slopes. Relate the Distance Formula to the Pythagorean Theorem and calculate point distances.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Classifying Triangles on the Coordinate Plane
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students classify triangles using side lengths and slopes and apply the converse of the Pythagorean Theorem to determine whether a triangle is acute, right, or obtuse.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Completing and Classifying Quadrilaterals on the Coordinate Plane
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students complete quadrilaterals on the coordinate plane, identify unknown vertices, graph quadrilaterals, and classify them using side lengths and slopes.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Classifying a Quadrilateral Formed by Midpoints
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students use the Midpoint Formula to calculate midpoints of quadrilateral sides, connect them, and identify the resulting quadrilateral.
Students determine the coordinate pair of a quadrilateral's vertex without a coordinate plane and describe how a translation yields the same result.
